newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Philippines, Hong Kong reach air accord.
newsitem.headline: Philippines, Hong Kong reach air accord.

text.p: Manila has secured a preliminary air services agreement allowing Philippine carriers to increase their services to Hong Kong, the presidential palace said on Thursday.
The new agreement will allow Philippine carriers to increase their maximum capacity to 11,500 seats a week from the present 9,500.
This will rise to 12,500 by 1997 and 13,000 by 1998, the palace said.
The new deal will also allow Philippine carriers the right to fly onward to Europe from Hong Kong.

The agreement was initialled earlier this month but will have to be vetted by the Sino-British Joint Liaison Group overseeing the British colony's transition to Chinese sovereignty next year, the statement said.
